Frank, are you saying, that if I put my radio inside, sitting inside a loop=
 
 it will take away the static?  It won't be connected to the radio or  
a=
nything though. sf
 
 
In a message dated 5/29/2010 2:31:23 P.M. Eastern Da=
ylight Time,  
purplealiengirl@... writes:

 
 
 
Formal box? These t=
hing are radio based, and static and noise kinda  come 
with the territroy.=
 Filter out the noise and many of the voices will  
probably be lost. There=
 are other methods though,lik eEVPmaker, which works  well 
for higher spir=
it contact. 
 
 You might try an external antenan, like C. Crane twin ferri=
te  antenna, 
you can also make a homemade  AM loop, it works by by placing=
  the radio 
inside tho loop so it has access to higher level signals.
 
 F=
-S

eL@...) >  wrote:

Here's an inte=
resting message I received last night, I was asking about  
confirmation of=
 what David keeps telling me,,here's what I got. There are  
several people=
 saying things, and me at the end repeating what I think I  hear 
the guy b=
efore me saying.   You'll need to listen at least  two times to 
hear it, b=
ecause of static, wish i could get my hands on one of  those formal 
boxes,=
 bet I could get some really good stuff, because they  don't seem to 
carry=
 so much static. Now, why is that I wonder.  Maybe I  can stop the static 
=
with this 20-125 some how. sf
